Yes, Filters are on their way out but if you still want to use your
own you=
 can in 1.x and here is how:

Create a JAR file containing your own code. M=
ake sure to include in
the JAR the file modules/Filter.options (i.e. the ro=
ot of the JAR file
should contain a directory named 'modules' which in turn=
s contains the
text file 'Filter.options').

Filter.options should have one=
 line for each Filter you'd like to add,
fully qualified class name (e.g.
o=
rg.archive.crawler.deciderules.DecidingFilter) and nothing else.

Place the=
 JAR in the %HERITRIX_HOME%/lib directory and Heritrix will
discover your f=
ilter when it is started. 

If you hand edit the configuration you can skip=
 the 'Filter.options'
file as it is only there to tell the UI what filters =
are available.

- Kris
